data.name: Airline fixer
data.description:
## Description:
You have been given a list of airport IDs ranging from ``` 0-n``` in an array. Along with each ID you also recieve the airport IDs that it connects directly to with one flight. 
#### Note
These connections are only one way, meaing that being able to travel from x-y does not mean you can immediately travel from y-x (though it could still be possible depending on the given data).
## Task
Create a function ```airlines``` which, given the airports and their connections, returns the ```minimum```  number of ```new```  connections that you will need to make to be able to travel from any airport ```x```  to any other airport ```y```. The number of airlines it takes to do this does NOT matter.
## Input
One list in the form ```[[a1, a2...], [b1, b2...]...]``` where the index of each sublist is the airport's ```ID``` and each integer in the sublist is the airports that it connects directly to.
## Example
Given the input: 

``` [[1], [0, 2], []]```

Someone can travel directly forom airport ```0 -> 1```; from ```1 -> 0 or 2```; and cannot travel anywhere from airport ```2```. 

We would return ```1``` here because we can add an airline from airport ```2 -> 0``` which then allows us to travel from ```0 -> 1 and 2```, ```from 1 -> 0 and 2``` and ```from 2 -> 0 and 1```.
